info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 12:37PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
At 1234 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms, lined up north to south, along the east slopes of the Sacramento mountains...over Mayhill, Sacramento, Weed, moving east at 10 mph.
HAZARD...Heavy rain, with local flooding of streams, arroyos, and low water crossing are the main threat. In addition, expect wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Flooding of low water crossings, and running of normally dry streams and arroyos possible.
Locations impacted include... Timberon, Sacramento, Pinon, Mayhill, Silver Lake, Weed, Elk Silver, Sixteen Springs, James Canyon, Hay Canyon, Cox Canyon, Avis, Upper Dry Burnt Canyon, Lower Dry Burnt Canyon, Lower Sixteen Springs Canyon, Elk Canyon, McDonald Flats, Bell Canyon, Whitetail, and Miller Flats.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
